instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
It have 20v on all usb port, can charge and turn on fine, but doesnt detect external usb
no 5v on L3500..<CHIP>U3500</CHIP> area looks fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message: from what i dechiper, <SIGNAL>UPC_X_5V_EN</SIGNAL> is either comes from <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> or <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, so how do I determine which one is the culprit?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
The other two USB-C ports are powered from LB700.
And  <SIGNAL>UPC_T_5V_EN</SIGNAL> comes from UB300/400.
Same behaviour on them?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>5V_S4_X</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>T_USBC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_S4_T_USBC</SIGNAL> diode mode is 0.161
<SIGNAL>5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL> diode mode is0.174

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
The webcam works?
If not, can be PCH issue.

However, try another USB-C hub...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
i notice that some port detected external usb..
but one particular port kill my external flashdrive ( it smoke when I plugged it ), its the left second port which is closest to the trackpad ( the sidethat doesnt have headphone jack ).
customer actually have told me this particular port killed his soundcard too..
maybe thats the one causing some problem.. how can I detect the fault ? if i charge there, its fine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message: i think it correspond to <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>, should i change it ? or is something shorting ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
do you mean <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> / <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> ? 
i changed <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> but still the same, now all port doesnt detect..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message:
The board has 4 input MOSFETs, one for each channel.
You must check them, or change directly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn on, but doesnt detect usb
threads.message: there's one damaged crystal near <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, changed it and all good now, its not in a schematic but. its. beside .... ( i will insert the componen name after i get. back. to shop)
